The university is classified as a "Doctoral/Professional" university by Carnegie Classification and is owned and governed by a privately appointed board of trustees. It has a population of approximately 5,435 undergraduate and 3,335 master's, Juris Doctor, and PhD students. The institution employs 522 full-time faculty members, divided between four professional schools and the College of Arts and Sciences, all located on the mission campus.

The university also includes the Jesuit School of Theology, which is one of two Jesuit seminaries in the United States with ecclesiastical faculties approved by the Vatican's Congregation for Catholic Education.
